awd_titl_txt: Engineering Research Equipment: Temperature-Programmed      Desorption/Oxidation/Reduction System
awd_abstract_narration: Components are acquired for the construction of an experimental                 facility to perform temperature-programmed desorption (TPD),                    temperature-programmed oxidation (TPD), and temperature-                        programmed reduction (TPR).  These are assembled into a working                 unit.                                                                                                                                                           The apparatus will be used in ongoing studies of the partial                    oxidation of methane to methanol and formaldhyde over molybdena-                based catalysts, synergy between manganese and molybdenum oxides                in the partial oxidation of hydrocarbons, and selective                         reduction of nitrogen oxides with ammonia over vanadia                          catalysts.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems

inst.inst_name: Ohio State University Research Foundation -DO NOT USE
